content.body: hi yall! does tc39 have any general newsletters or rss feeds that one can subscribe to to get notified on the latest proposals?

content.body: But if you 'watch' https://github.com/tc39/proposals, I think you'll get a notification whenever that repo changes, which might suffice?

content.body: (actually, you'll get notifications for more than just that, but you can filter out what you're not interested in)

content.body: It can even be an RSS feed! But I bet people have thought of that and maybe there were issues with it?
So not just "here's a new proposal", but also "this proposal (active but not 'new' per se) changed in such-and-such a way" ?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: So not just "here's a new proposal", but also "this proposal (active but not 'new' per se) changed in such-and-such a way" ?

content.body: (Because I can imagine automating the first, but not the second.)

content.body: yeah i think starting with the first (the automation part), then going with some more detailed things

content.body: Well, on second thought, you could automate the second, saying things like "In the X-proposal repo, these PRs were merged, these issues were closed, these were opened", that sort of thing.
